question.title: Javamail: can FetchProfile be used when searching mails instead of just fetching them?

elements.contents: Message[] msgs = folder.getMessages(); FetchProfile fp = new FetchProfile(); fp.add(FetchProfile.Item.ENVELOPE); folder.fetch(msgs, fp);

units.rawText: Message[] msgs = folder.getMessages(); FetchProfile fp = new FetchProfile(); fp.add(FetchProfile.Item.ENVELOPE); folderfetch(msgs, fp);

node.contents: However, if I want to get only the read messages by using search(), I don't have a means to specify a FetchProfile (as search() doesn't take such a parameter).

astNode.text: However, if I want to get only the read messages by using search(), I don't have a means to specify a FetchProfile (as search() doesn't take such a parameter).

elements.contents: Folder inbox = store.getFolder("Inbox"); inbox.open(Folder.READ_WRITE); FlagTerm ft = new FlagTerm(new Flags(Flags.Flag.SEEN), false); Message messages[] = inbox.search(ft); //how to specify a FetchProfile here ??

units.rawText: Folder inbox = store.getFolder("Inbox"); inbox.open(Folder.READ_WRITE); FlagTerm ft = new FlagTerm(new Flags(Flags.Flag.SEEN), false); Message messages[] = inbox.search(ft); //how to specify a FetchProfile here ??

node.contents: In this, JavaMail mirrors the underlying IMAP commands -- first you figure out the set of messages that you're interested in, then you fetch data on those messages via a separate command. There's no way to coerce an IMAP server to return you FetchProfile-style data from a SEARCH command, and JavaMail is just conforming to IMAP's constraints on what gets returned when.

astNode.text: In this, JavaMail mirrors the underlying IMAP commands -- first you figure out the set of messages that you're interested in, then you fetch data on those messages via a separate command. There's no way to coerce an IMAP server to return you FetchProfile-style data from a SEARCH command, and JavaMail is just conforming to IMAP's constraints on what gets returned when.
